summary: This bill, the Caribbean Basin Security Initiative Authorization Act, authorizes the Secretary of State and USAID to carry out an initiative in beneficiary countries to promote citizen safety, counter transnational crime, advance law enforcement and rule of law, prevent crime among at-risk youth, strengthen disaster resilience, combat corruption, and counter malign influence from authoritarian regimes. It authorizes $88 million annually from 2025-2029 and requires the submission of an implementation plan and annual progress reports to Congress. The initiative includes programs and a strategy to increase natural disaster response and resilience.
